comment.author: 92149915@N08
comment._content: Gordon was born on the 28th of December 1892 and was 22 when he enlisted in the AIF on the 3rd of September 1914 as per here His Father was Matthew Alford and his Mother was Mary Ann Hebron Heithersay as per here At the time of his enlistment he named his next of kins address as that of his father at 23 Harrow Road, St. Peters, South Australia

comment.author: 94887188@N04
comment._content: I was honored to stand with Mr Alfords great Nephew yesterday as part of his school tour of the War Memorial in Canberra, Australia to place a poppy in remembrance of his Great Uncles sacrifice and to all those who sacrificed for those oppressed in a time of need many thousands of miles from loved ones and home in which their sacrifice was so gallantly given. Lest We Forget [http://www.flickr.com/photos/94887188@N04/8641539177/in/photostream]

comment.author: 89062420@N02
comment._content: Please note that Forces War Records has been in contact with this family and they have VERY kindly donated the War Diaries of Pte Alford. They make fabulous reading and are free to access, thus making a great source of information to researchers, historians, enthusiasts, families and students and preserves the memories and events of these most important parts of history. See more here: www.forces-war-records.co.uk/Library/Document/1879/Pt-Gor...(aif)-Australian-Imperial-Force-Account-Of-Landing-At-Gallipoli-Peninsular?searchCategory=War%20Diary&searchPage=2&filterPagesOnSearchQuery=False&filterPagesOnSearchQueryExact=True
